title: Recipe Fusion: Rib Eye Steaks with Potatoes Au Gratin

preparationSteps.title: Prep Step 1
preparationSteps.mainStep: Prepare the meat marinade. In a large zip-loc back, combine
bullets: 1 teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of freshly ground pepper
¼ cup of olive oil
¼ cup of balsamic vinegar
¼ cup Worcestershire sauce
2 rosemary sprigs

preparationSteps.title: Prep Step 2
bullets: Pat dry the 2 rib-eye steaks (~1.25 lbs each)
Add the steak to the bag with the marinade
Put in the fridge and marinate for at least 2 hours and up to 12 hours (we usually marinate the steaks in the morning and cook for dinner)
Remove the steak from the fridge and bring to room temperature

preparationSteps.title: Prep Step 3
bullets: Peel the 6-10 potatoes (3 pounds) and slice into ¼-inch slices. Set aside in a large bowl
Layer potato slices in a 10- or 12-inch ovenproof skillet, seasoning each layer with salt and pepper as you go. (5 minutes)
Dot the top with 2 Tablespoons butter.
Pour in 2 to 3 cups of heavy cream (it should come about ¾ of the way to the top, the amount will depend on the size of your skillet).

preparationSteps.title: Prep Step 4
preparationSteps.mainStep: Gather and prepare the other ingredients for the potatoes
bullets: Grate ¼ cup Gruyère cheese if not already grated and place in a small bowl. Set aside
A pinch of nutmeg

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 1
cookingSteps.mainStep: Remove the meat from the fridge and bring to room temperature, about 30 minutes before start cooking
bullets: Pat the steak dry with a paper towel

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 3
cookingSteps.mainStep: Heat the oven-proof 12-10 inch skillet with the potatoes over medium-high heat
bullets: Bring the potatoes to a boil (3 minutes)

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 4
bullets: Cook potatoes, uncovered, until the liquid has reduced by about half. (10 minutes)

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 5
cookingSteps.mainStep: Transfer the potato skillet to the preheated 350o degree oven
bullets: Bake potatoes until fork-tender and the top is nicely browned. (15 minutes)

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 6
cookingSteps.mainStep: Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat
bullets: Add and heat 2 Tablespoons of canola oil, enough to have a thin layer of oil (2 minutes)
Add the steaks to the cast iron and cook steaks until the first side is brown and seared (3 minutes)
Flip the steaks and cook steaks the other side until browned and seared (3 minutes)

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 7
cookingSteps.mainStep: Put the cast iron skillet with the steak in the preheated 350 degree oven
bullets: The time in the oven will depend on the thickness of your steak and the doneness level. Cook steak in the oven. (5 minutes)
At 5 minutes, check the temperature
For medium rare (our recommended doneness), we remove the steak when the temperature is 127o
For medium, remove the steak at 135o
For medium-well, remove the steak at 145o
For well done (it will be a bit dry), remove at 155o

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 8
bullets: When the steaks reach the desired temperature, remove them from the skillet and let them rest on a cutting board

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 9
bullets: When the bake potato's 15-minute timer goes off, check if the potatoes are fork tender and the top is nicely browned; if not, place it back for 2-3 minutes more
Remove from oven, top with ¼ cup grated cheese, and return to the oven. Cook potatoes until the cheese is melty and golden brown. (3-5 minutes)
Remove from oven, sprinkle with a pinch of nutmeg and serve

cookingSteps.title: Cooking Step 10
bullets: Slice the steaks, and serve with the potato gratin

Dairy: ¼ cup Gruyère cheese or Parmesan, grated
